page.title: 02THE VILLAGE OF ABBOTS MORTON
page.content: {ABBOTS MORTON }is a quiet,peaceful village with 48 houses which are beautiful to look at.There is a lovely little church,St.Peter's,which dates back to the 12th century.It was restored by the Norman Lord of the Manor.Nearby is a moat where the monks used to catch their fish.It is on private land,but ask to see it because it is interesting.If you walk down{ {ABBOTS MORTON'S} only road you will see the milk churn steps,used a long time ago to put milk churns on.At the other end of the village is the Post Office and if you go there you may hear about the post mistress' cat and how he saved her from some robbers.If you carry on you will come to a pig farm.There are no shops in{ABBOTS {MORTON}only the Post Office which sells sweets.If you do visit{ABBOTS {MORTON}you will love it.
